Name: Issue 330
Introduction: Here in Australia we don't celebrate Thanksgiving, however, to all of you who do celebrate such things we hope you had a relaxcing and wonderful time with your family and friends. Also, please check out UnoConf which is right around the corner, but in the meantime, enjoy this weeks edition. ♥️ Kym

Articles.Title: Integrating App Linking in a Xamarin app for Android
Articles.Description: This article looks at how to combine App Linking and App Gallery Connect within Xamarin Android.
Articles.Author: Zachary Powell

Articles.Title: Xamarin Community Toolkit Succinctly Author Alessandro Del Sole
Articles.Description: This is a brief interview with author Alessandro Del Sole, whose book Xamarin Community Toolkit Succinctly was recently published. You can download the book from the Syncfusion ebook portal.
Articles.Author: Alessandro Del Sole

Articles.Title: Validation using Xamarin Community Toolkit Part 2
Articles.Description: Additional validation options using Xamarin Community Toolkit in Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Author: Delpin Susai Raj

Articles.Title: First iOS, Android and Windows Mobile App using Visual studio 2022
Articles.Description: This post covers creating, building and debugging your First MAUI application using Visual Studio 2022.
Articles.Author: Suthahar Jegatheesan

Articles.Title: Sands of MAUI: Issue #34
Articles.Description: A wrap-up of the week's happenings over in MAUI world.
Articles.Author: Sam Basu

Articles.Title: .NET Conf 2021: Updates in .NET MAUI
Articles.Description: Sabastian covers some of the MAUI sessions that surfaced at .NET Conf.
Articles.Author: Sebastián Pérez

Articles.Title: Merge Conflict: 281: C# 10, .NET MAUI, Blazor Hybrid, and more!
Articles.Description: .NET Conf is over and we get hands on with live .NET 6 bits and get excited about all sorts of new features! We cover all sorts of goodies in this lighting topic podcast.
Articles.Author: Merge Conflict

Articles.Title: Null Pointers 75: .NET Conf Updates
Articles.Description: So .NET Conf happened a few days ago. Steven visited a conference in person. So perfect time to look at all the new shiny stuff that just was released.
Articles.Author: Null Pointers
